intro: Gossania, commonly known as the African violet, is a genus of flowering plants native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plants typically have thick, velvety leaves and are often cultivated as ornamental plants due to their beauty and ease of care. Gossania species are generally evergreen and thrive in well-drained soil with moderate light conditions. They are popular in horticulture for their ability to bloom repeatedly throughout the growing season.
